definition: to dismiss with a laugh/to make light of
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
laugh/smile/CL:個|个[ge4]
to install/to place/to put/to buy
(possessive particle, literary equivalent of 的[de5])/him/her/it

sentences.english: You’ve been a good sport to laugh at the trick we played on you.
sentences.chinese: 你真是個有雅量的人，對我們的惡作劇一笑置之。

sentences.english: Learn how to laugh it off.
The president laughed off the awkward situation.
sentences.chinese: 總統對尷尬的處境一笑置之。

sentences.english: An actor has to learn to laugh off bad reviews.
sentences.chinese: 演員要學會能對貶斥性評論一笑置之的本領。

sentences.english: Rielly just laughed at my reasoning.
sentences.chinese: 裏利對我的推理只是一笑置之。

sentences.english: This no-nonsense attitude makes him an absolute joy to work with.
sentences.chinese: 然而，對這種廢話少說的工作態度，他大可一笑置之。

sentences.english: Later I heard that Rundstedt laughed off the alarm .
sentences.chinese: 後來，我聽說倫斯德對這種驚慌一笑置之。

sentences.english: Yet Mugabe apparently tries to laugh off his global infamy.
sentences.chinese: 然而穆加貝顯然對他在國際社會上的臭名一笑置之。

sentences.english: A clear conscience laughs at false accusation.
sentences.chinese: 只要問心無愧，無端指責可一笑置之。

sentences.english: I was astonished at how much they were able to laugh things off.
sentences.chinese: 我驚訝於他們究竟在多大程度可以如此一笑置之。

sentences.english: All this scuttle butt was laughed off as nonsense.
sentences.chinese: 這些小道消息被當作一派胡言而一笑置之。

sentences.english: A childish idea like that can be amusedly tolerated.
sentences.chinese: 像那樣幼稚的想法可以一笑置之。

sentences.english: You can laugh for things you are not so sure with.
sentences.chinese: 你不確定的事情就可以一笑置之。

sentences.english: These hearsay are treated as nonsense and push it away with a smile.
sentences.chinese: 這些小道消息被當作一派胡言而一笑置之。

definition: to dismiss sth with a laugh (idiom)/to laugh it off
to laugh away (instead of taking seriously)
not to mind/unconcerned
to snort disdainfully/to scoff at/to turn up one's nose
to disdain as beneath contempt (idiom)
see 泰然處之|泰然处之[tai4 ran2 chu3 zhi1]
to mind/to brood over/to be concerned about
to pay no attention to/not to mind
to play deaf-mute
lips sealed and not saying anything (idiom); fig. to omit mention (of a non-person or embarrassing topic)/to censor
not to accept as correct (idiom); to object/to disapprove/to take exception to
to not mind (at all, a bit)/to not care in the slightest
frigid irony and scorching satire (idiom); to mock and ridicule
to care about/to take seriously/to take to heart
a matter of no concern to oneself (idiom)
sarcastic comments (idiom)/to make sarcastic comments
